<strong style="display: block;">A firm has EBIT of 500 million, pays interest of 150 million, and faces a 21% corporate tax rate. What is the value of the annual interest tax shield?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q87" value="D"> D. $50 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q87" value="E"> E. $10.5 million</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module8_mcq_q87" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C.  
The annual tax shield equals the interest expense multiplied by the corporate tax rate:
